result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelina Medina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow early termination of probation if deemed by Agent.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Sign all releases to Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Parenting classes to be determined by Agent.
Costs and DNA Surcharge waived.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelina Medina

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Angelina Medina in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery for Tedia K. Gamino.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #2
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
30 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  
Term of Probation:1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession or alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Sign all releases to agent
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided 
Parenting classes to be determined by Agent.  
Court will allow early termination of probation if deemed by agent
COSTS:  Waived
DNA Surcharge: Waived
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Angelina Medina in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery for attorney Tedia K. Gamino.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Tedia K. Gamino in court.   Defendant Angelina Medina did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Buttery advises she has requested discovery.  DA gives discovery in court.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Angelina Medina in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to seek counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
